revision.comment: [[WP:CHECKWIKI]] error fix for #61. Punctuation goes before References. Do [[Wikipedia:GENFIXES|general fixes]] if a problem exists. - using [[Project:AWB|AWB]] (8853)
revision.text:
{{Infobox company | name = Couchbase, Inc. | company_logo = [[File:Couchbase, Inc. official logo.png]] | type = [[Private company|Private]] | foundation = 2011 | key_people = Bob Wiederhold (CEO)
Rahim Yaseen (SVP Engineering)
Damien Katz (CTO) | location_city = Mountain View, California | industry = Software | num_employees = 100+ | location_country = USA | homepage = [http://www.couchbase.com www.couchbase.com] }} '''Couchbase, Inc.''' is a software company that develops and provides commercial packages and support for [[Couchbase Server]], an [[open-source software|open-source]], [[NoSQL]], [[document-oriented database]] that can be used both as a document database that stores [[JSON]] documents or a pure [[key-value database]]. The company headquarters is in [[Mountain View, California]] with offices in San Francisco, United Kingdom, Germany, France, and Portugal.http://www.couchbase.com/contact Couchbase is a privately held company with approximately $30 Million in venture capital funding from [[Accel Partners]], [[Mayfield Fund]] and Ignition Partners.http://www.ignitionpartners.com/ Recognition and awards include the 2012 Infoworld Bossie award,http://www.couchbase.com/press-releases/couchbase-open-source-database-named-winner-2012-infoworld-bossie-awards Dataweek 2012 award,http://www.couchbase.com/press-releases/couchbase-selected-dataweek-award-2012-winner Always-On Global award,http://www.couchbase.com/press-releases/couchbase-selected-alwayson-global-250-winner VentureWire's 50 FASTTech companies ,http://www.couchbase.com/press-releases/couchbase-makes-venturewire-fastech-50 GigaOM's Structure 50 list http://www.couchbase.com/press-releases/couchbase-named-to-gigaom-structure-50 and the Gartner cool vendor award.http://www.couchbase.com/press-releases/couchbase-named-gartner-cool-vendor ==History== Couchbase Inc. was created through the merger of Membase Inc. and CouchOne Inc. in 2011. Membase Inc. was founded in 2009 and developed and provided commercial packages and support for the Couchbase Server open source project, a NoSQL key-value database that leverages [[memcached]] technology. CouchOne Inc. was also founded in 2009 and developed and provided commercial support for the Apache [[CouchDB]] open source project, a NoSQL document database. The merged company aimed to combine the strengths of Membase (and Memcached) as well as Apache CouchDB to build a easily scalable, high-performance document-oriented NoSQL database. ==Couchbase Open Source Project== [[Couchbase Server|Couchbase]] is an open source NoSQL database that can be used as either a document-oriented or pure key-value database and is supported by Couchbase Inc. and licensed under the [[Apache 2.0 licensing|Apache 2.0 license]]. It aims for easy scalability, consistent high performance, high reliability and ease of development. When used as a document-oriented database, data is stored in [[JSON]] format which can be indexed and queried. While Couchbase took inspiration from Apache CouchDB and memcached, it is a completely different and separate open source project. It has a separate and independent community, provides a very different set of capabilities, and supports very different use cases. More specifically, Couchbase leveraged and modified memcached technology to provide built-in caching and leveraged and modified Apache CouchDB technology to enable the document capabilities in recent releases of Couchbase. Couchbase open source project,https://github.com/couchbasehttps://github.com/couchbaselabs development is based around [[Github]] source-control and the community is encouraged to contribute to the open source project.http://www.couchbase.com/wiki/display/couchbase/Contributing+Changes Couchbase is used at several companies including [[Zynga]] and [[SHFL entertainment|Shufflemaster]] for gaming, [[AOL]] and [[DG (company)|MediaMind]] for ad platforms, [[Salesforce.com]] and [[Concur]] for SaaS business applications, [[Orbitz]] and [[Sabre Holdings|Sabre]] for e-commerce, and [[Thomson Reuters]] and [[McGraw-Hill]] for online media. ==See also== {{Commons category|Database}} {{Commons category|Database models}} * [[Cloud computing]] * [[Cloud infrastructure]] * [[Database-centric architecture]] * [[NoSQL (concept)|NoSQL]] ==References== {{reflist}} == External links == * [http://www.couchbase.com Couchbase Official Couchbase Website] * [https://github.com/couchbase Couchbase Github Repository] * [https://github.com/couchbaselabs Couchbase Labs Github Repository] * [http://review.couchbase.org/ Couchbase Gerrit Code Review] *[http://www.couchbase.com/wiki/display/couchbase/Building+Couchbase+from+Source Building Couchbase Source Code] * [https://www.twitter.com/couchbase Official Couchbase Twitter Page] * [http://blog.couchbase.com/ Official Couchbase Blog] * [http://www.couchbase.com/events Official Couchbase Events Page] * [http://www.couchbase.com/wiki/display/couchbase/Communities+around+the+globe Couchbase communities around the globe] * [http://groups.google.com/group/Couchbase/ Couchbase Google Groups] * [http://www.couchbase.com/couchdb Comparing Couchbase with CouchDB] * [http://www.networkworld.com/community/blog/couchbase-scores-14m-new-funding/ Couchbase Scores 14m In New Funding] * [http://www.finsmes.com/2011/10/couchbase-receives-1m-strategic-investment-docomo-capital.html/ Strategic Couchbase Investment from DOCOMO Capital] [[Category:NoSQL]] [[Category:Free database management systems]] [[Category:Distributed computing architecture]] [[Category:Cross-platform software]] [[Category:Structured storage]] [[Category:Companies based in Mountain View, California]] [[Category:Companies established in 2011]]
